Signed-off-by: Tom Kaitchuck <tom.kaitchuck@emc.com>

timeline.bodyText:
If an Append/event is greater than MAX_BATCH_SIZE then the CommandEncoder is the one which will split it. But since the number of permits in the throttle is bounded by MAX_BATCH_SIZE the thread would indefinitely wait when the append size > MAX_BATCH_SIZE, causing the CommandEncoder in the subsequent pipeline stage to be never invoked.
This caused an issue with io.pravega.test.integration.ByteStreamTest#readLargeWrite
timeline.author: shrids

timeline.author: shrids

timeline.bodyText: callback.complete() below should invoke nettyHandler.setRecentMessage() right ?
timeline.author: shrids

timeline.bodyText:
These are the two changes in client behavior, right?

This change implies keep-alive is sent every 20 seconds even if the connection is healthy.
If there is a connection stall for more than 20 seconds then the connection is closed.
timeline.author: shrids

timeline.bodyText: Can we log indicating that sending a keep-alive failed here?
timeline.author: shrids

timeline.bodyText: this test causes the InMemoryDurableDataLog to go OOM on my dev box...
timeline.author: shrids

replies.bodyText:
Looks like you're sending in 1000 x 1MB buffers for a total of 1GB. That is a bit too extreme.
If you do want to keep this test as it is, may I recommend truncating the segment after every few writes you're sending? That should help clear memory pressure.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu
